etymology.description: semantic 出 (“go out”) + phonetic 買 (“buy”); later 出 reduced to 士; simplified from 賣 (買 → 买).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the 'go out' idea (出) with the sound from 'buy' (買), evoking goods taken out to be sold. Over time the top component was reduced to 士, and the simplified form replaces 買 with 买 while keeping the same pronunciation and sense.
etymology.simplification: Replaced 買 with its simplified form 买 to reduce strokes; the top component remained as 士. Overall simplified from 賣.

examples.chinese: 我在市场卖水果(我在市場賣水果)。
examples.english: I sell fruit at the market.

examples.chinese: 他为了利益出卖朋友(他為了利益出賣朋友)。
examples.english: He sold out his friend for profit.

examples.chinese: 她喜欢卖弄学问(她喜歡賣弄學問)。
examples.english: She likes to show off her learning.
